definition: Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)

sentences.english: Zhou Dynasty's historiographers and Zhouli have a close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 周代史官與周禮之間有着密切的關係。

sentences.english: The Zhou dynasty was founded by the Ji family and had its capital at Hào.
sentences.chinese: 周代是由籍家庭，而且其資本在浩。

sentences.english: Guan-Li (Amenity of Manhood) customized to the formation in the Zhou Dynasty, has long been in use since then.
sentences.chinese: 冠禮至周代形成定製，此後長期被沿用。

sentences.english: The earliest source of Binxing ceremony is the Xiangyinjiu ceremony in Zhou Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 賓興禮的最早源頭是周代鄉飲酒禮。

sentences.english: Winter festival existed at the time of the Zhou dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 冬節在中國的周代就已經有了。

sentences.english: Poetry in the culture of the Zhou Dynasty why lunwen114there is such a high position?
sentences.chinese: 詩在周代文化中何以有那麼高的地位？

sentences.english: This part mainly analyzes every cultural factor in the wedding of Zhou dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 這一部分主要分析了周代婚禮所包含的各項文化因素。

sentences.english: This system of marriage and concubinage made women experience a disastrous decline in terms of their social position.
sentences.chinese: 周代這種異姓嫡媵婚制，使周代女性地位一落千丈。

sentences.english: This system of marriage and concubinage made women experience a disastrous decline in terms of their social position.
sentences.chinese: 周代這種異姓嫡媵婚制，使周代女性地位一落千丈。

sentences.english: The rise and decline of the culture of Zhou Dynasty can explain the both courses.
sentences.chinese: 詩意流變的過程是與周代禮樂文化的興衰相始終的。

sentences.english: Zhou Dynasty is a very important period in the Chinese history of immigration.
sentences.chinese: 周代正是我國移民史上一個重要時期。

sentences.english: The Zhou Dynasty was the period which the Rite-music Culture had the most celebrated stage.
sentences.chinese: 周代是我國曆史上禮樂文化最鼎盛的時期。

sentences.english: The Farming Poetry in The book of songs is the outcome of the agriculture culture in the Zhou dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《詩經》農事詩是周代農業文化背景下的產物。

sentences.english: Are the Zhou' s Fengguoes city states?

definition: the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Qin dynasty (221-207 BC), founded by the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2], the first dynasty to rule the whole of China
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods/Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)

definition: the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
